segment.source: This article describes how to add adaptive streaming of multimedia content with Microsoft PlayReady content protection to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This article describes how to add adaptive streaming of multimedia content with Microsoft PlayReady content protection to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: Adaptive Streaming with PlayReady
segment.target: Adaptive Streaming with PlayReady

segment.source: Adaptive Streaming with PlayReady
segment.target: Adaptive Streaming with PlayReady

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article describes how to add adaptive streaming of multimedia content with Microsoft PlayReady content protection to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This article describes how to add adaptive streaming of multimedia content with Microsoft PlayReady content protection to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: This feature currently supports playback of Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.
segment.target: This feature currently supports playback of Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.

segment.source: HLS (Apple's HTTP Live Streaming) is not supported with PlayReady.
segment.target: HLS (Apple's HTTP Live Streaming) is not supported with PlayReady.

segment.source: Smooth Streaming is also currently not supported natively; however, PlayReady is extensible and by using additional code or libraries, PlayReady-protected Smooth Streaming can be supported, leveraging software or even hardware DRM (digital rights management).
segment.target: Smooth Streaming is also currently not supported natively; however, PlayReady is extensible and by using additional code or libraries, PlayReady-protected Smooth Streaming can be supported, leveraging software or even hardware DRM (digital rights management).

segment.source: This article only deals with the aspects of adaptive streaming specific to PlayReady.
segment.target: This article only deals with the aspects of adaptive streaming specific to PlayReady.

segment.source: For information about implementing adaptive streaming in general, see Adaptive Streaming.
segment.target: For information about implementing adaptive streaming in general, see Adaptive Streaming.

segment.source: This article uses code from the Adaptive streaming sample in Microsoft's Windows-universal-samples repository on GitHub.
segment.target: This article uses code from the Adaptive streaming sample in Microsoft's Windows-universal-samples repository on GitHub.

segment.source: Scenario 4 deals with using adaptive streaming with PlayReady.
segment.target: Scenario 4 deals with using adaptive streaming with PlayReady.

segment.source: You can download the repo in a ZIP file by navigating to the root level of the repository and clicking the Download ZIP button.
segment.target: You can download the repo in a ZIP file by navigating to the root level of the repository and clicking the Download ZIP button.

segment.source: The LicenseRequest namespace is from CommonLicenseRequest.cs, a PlayReady file provided by Microsoft to licensees.
segment.target: The LicenseRequest namespace is from CommonLicenseRequest.cs, a PlayReady file provided by Microsoft to licensees.

segment.target: You will need to declare a few global variables:

segment.target: You will also want to declare the following constant:

segment.source: Setting up the MediaProtectionManager
segment.target: Setting up the MediaProtectionManager

segment.source: To add PlayReady content protection to your UWP app, you will need to set up a MediaProtectionManager object.
segment.target: To add PlayReady content protection to your UWP app, you will need to set up a MediaProtectionManager object.

segment.source: You do this when initializing your AdaptiveMediaSource object.
segment.target: You do this when initializing your AdaptiveMediaSource object.

segment.source: The following code sets up a MediaProtectionManager:
segment.target: The following code sets up a MediaProtectionManager:

segment.source: This code can simply be copied to your app, since it is mandatory for setting up content protection.
segment.target: This code can simply be copied to your app, since it is mandatory for setting up content protection.

segment.source: The ComponentLoadFailed event is fired when the load of binary data fails.
segment.target: The ComponentLoadFailed event is fired when the load of binary data fails.

segment.source: We need to add an event handler to handle this, signaling that the load did not complete:
segment.target: We need to add an event handler to handle this, signaling that the load did not complete:

segment.source: Similarly, we need to add an event handler for the ServiceRequested event, which fires when a service is requested.
segment.target: Similarly, we need to add an event handler for the ServiceRequested event, which fires when a service is requested.

segment.source: Individualization service requests
segment.target: Individualization service requests

segment.source: The following code reactively makes a PlayReady individualization service request.
segment.target: The following code reactively makes a PlayReady individualization service request.

segment.source: We pass in the request as a parameter to the function.
segment.target: We pass in the request as a parameter to the function.

segment.target: We surround the call in a try/catch block, and if there are no exceptions, we say the request completed successfully:

segment.source: License acquisition service requests
segment.target: License acquisition service requests

segment.source: If instead the request was a PlayReadyLicenseAcquisitionServiceRequest, we call the below function to request and acquire the PlayReady license.
segment.target: If instead the request was a PlayReadyLicenseAcquisitionServiceRequest, we call the below function to request and acquire the PlayReady license.

segment.source: We tell the MediaProtectionServiceCompletion object that we passed in whether the request was successful or not, and we complete the request:
segment.target: We tell the MediaProtectionServiceCompletion object that we passed in whether the request was successful or not, and we complete the request:

segment.source: Initializing the AdaptiveMediaSource
segment.target: Initializing the AdaptiveMediaSource

segment.source: Finally, you will need a function to initialize the AdaptiveMediaSource, created from a given Uri and MediaElement.
segment.target: Finally, you will need a function to initialize the AdaptiveMediaSource, created from a given Uri and MediaElement.

segment.source: The Uri should be the link to the media file (HLS or DASH); the MediaElement should be defined in your XAML.
segment.target: The Uri should be the link to the media file (HLS or DASH); the MediaElement should be defined in your XAML.

segment.source: You can call this function in whichever event handles the start of adaptive streaming—for instance, in a button click event.
segment.target: You can call this function in whichever event handles the start of adaptive streaming—for instance, in a button click event.
